sn8.6:4.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn8.6:4.2: Now at that time Venerable Sāriputta was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants in the assembly hall with a Dharma talk. His words were polished, clear, articulate, and expressed the meaning.
sn8.6:4.3: And those mendicants were paying attention, focusing, concentrating, and listening well.
sn8.6:4.5: “This Venerable Sāriputta is educating the mendicants. …
sn8.6:4.6: And those mendicants were paying attention, focusing, concentrating, and listening well.
sn8.6:4.7: Why don’t I extoll him in his presence with appropriate verses?”
sn8.6:5.1: Then Venerable Vaṅgīsa got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his cupped palms toward Sāriputta, and said:
sn8.6:5.2: “I feel inspired to speak, Reverend Sāriputta! I feel inspired to speak, Reverend Sāriputta!”
sn8.6:5.3: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said Sāriputta.
sn8.6:5.4: Then Vaṅgīsa extolled Sāriputta in his presence with appropriate verses.

sn8.6:8.2: the mendicants listen to his sweet voice,
